title: AutoCAD: How to Reset to Default Settings
problem: AutoCAD is experiencing issues such as missing toolbars/ribbons, slow performance, crashes, or corrupt custom settings. Resetting the program to its default settings is the most common and effective solution.
solution:
1. Close all AutoCAD applications.
2. Open the Windows Start Menu.
3. Navigate to the folder for your AutoCAD version (e.g., AutoCAD 20xx).
4. Click the application named 'Reset Settings to Default'.
5. Choose 'Back up and Reset Custom Settings' option.
6. Allow the reset utility to run. AutoCAD will re-launch with fresh settings.

title: Civil 3D: How to Clean and Repair a Corrupt Drawing
problem: A specific drawing file is causing issues: extremely slow to open/save, excessively large file size, crashes when working, or errors appear when opening. This is often caused by drawing corruption or accumulated unreferenced data.
solution:
1. AUDIT: Open the drawing, type AUDIT, press Enter, type Y to fix errors.
2. PURGE (RegApps): Type -PURGE, type R, press Enter, accept *, type N when asked to verify.
3. PURGE (All): Type PURGE, check all checkboxes, click 'Purge All', repeat until grayed out.
4. SAVE: Save the drawing.
5. WBLOCK (if needed): Type WBLOCK, select 'Entire drawing', specify new file name, click OK.

title: Revit: How to Improve Slow Performance in a Model
problem: A Revit model is performing poorly: slow to open, sync, or save. Navigation (panning, zooming, orbiting) is sluggish.
solution:
1. Close Background Views: Go to View tab > Windows > Close Hidden Windows.
2. Reduce Detail Level: Change view to 'Coarse' detail.
3. Turn Off Shadows: View tab > Graphics > uncheck 'Shadows'.
4. Disable Design Options: Manage tab > Design Options > set to 'Main Model'.
5. Purge Unused: Manage tab > Purge Unused.
6. Audit File: File > Save As > Options > check 'Maximum Backup', check 'Audit'.
7. Compact File: File > Save As > Options > check 'Compact File'.

title: AutoCAD: Command Line is Missing or Has Disappeared
problem: The command line has disappeared from the AutoCAD interface. User cannot type commands.
solution:
1. Press Ctrl + 9 (toggles command line on/off).
2. If that doesn't work, type COMMANDLINE in the search bar at top of screen and press Enter.
3. To dock it at bottom: Right-click the command line > select 'Dock' > 'Bottom'.

title: AutoCAD: Plot Style (CTB/STB File) is Missing or Not Found
problem: When plotting, the 'Plot style table' dropdown is blank or missing the company-standard CTB file. Drawing may plot in full color instead of black and white.
solution:
1. Type OPTIONS in command line, press Enter.
2. Go to 'Files' tab.
3. Expand 'Printer Support File Path'.
4. Expand 'Plot Style Table Search Path'.
5. Check the path listed. It must point to the network folder where company CTB files are stored.
6. If path is missing/incorrect, add correct path, click Apply, restart AutoCAD.

title: AutoCAD: FATAL ERROR - Unhandled Access Violation
problem: AutoCAD crashes on startup or while opening a file, showing a 'FATAL ERROR' message mentioning 'unhandled access violation'. Often caused by corrupt user profile or graphics issues.
solution:
1. Disable Hardware Acceleration: Right-click AutoCAD icon > Properties. In 'Target' field, add space and type /nohardware. Click Apply and launch.
2. If it opens, update Graphics Driver: Go to NVIDIA or AMD website and install latest certified driver.
3. Reset User Profile: Use 'Reset Settings to Default' utility (see KB Article 1).

title: AutoCAD: Cursor is Laggy, Jittery, or Slow
problem: The mouse cursor in AutoCAD is slow, jittery, or has a delay when moving around the drawing.
solution:
1. Disable Hardware Acceleration: Type GRAPHICSCONFIG in command line.
2. Uncheck 'Hardware Acceleration', click OK.
3. Restart AutoCAD.
4. If issue persists, update graphics driver to latest version.

title: Revit: Error 'Cannot Synchronize with Central' (Sync Stuck)
problem: User tries to Synchronize with Central but gets an error or the sync hangs at a percentage. Common causes: network issues, permissions, or corrupt local file.
solution:
1. Check Network Connection: Ensure stable connection to server/cloud.
2. Close and Reopen: Close Revit, reopen the local file, try sync again.
3. Relinquish Worksets: Go to Collaborate tab > Worksets > Relinquish All Mine.
4. Create New Local: Delete your local file, go to server/BIM 360, click 'Create New Local'.
5. Check Permissions: Verify you have write access to Central Model location.

title: Revit: Element is Not Visible in a View (Visibility Checklist)
problem: An element (wall, door, furniture, etc.) exists in the model but is not visible in a specific view.
solution:
1. Check View Range: View Properties > View Range > ensure Cut Plane and View Depth include element.
2. Check Visibility Graphics (VG): Type VG > ensure category is checked ON.
3. Check Filter: View Properties > Filters > check if a filter is hiding the element.
4. Check Workset Visibility: Type VG > Worksets tab > ensure workset is visible.
5. Check Phase: View Properties > Phase Filter > ensure element's phase is shown.
6. Check Hide in View: Select element > right-click > 'Unhide in View' > 'Category'.

title: Revit: Linked Model (RVT or DWG) is Not Found or Unloaded
problem: A linked file (like an architectural background or DWG site plan) is missing. 'Manage Links' dialog may appear, or link shows as 'Not Found'.
solution:
1. Go to Manage tab > Manage Links.
2. Find the missing link (status: 'Not Found').
3. Select the link, click 'Reload From...'.
4. Navigate to correct location on server and select it.
5. If path type was the problem (e.g., Absolute), you may need to 'Remove' the link and 'Add' it back using 'Relative' or 'Network Path' setting.

title: Revit: How to Repair a Corrupt Family (RFA) File
problem: User tries to load a family file (.RFA) and Revit crashes or gives 'Cannot load family' or 'File is corrupt' error.
solution:
1. Do NOT load family directly.
2. Open Revit without any project open.
3. Go to File > Open > Family.
4. Navigate to corrupt RFA file and select it.
5. CHECK THE 'AUDIT' BOX in open dialog.
6. Click 'Open'. Revit will audit and repair the file.
7. Once open, go to Manage > Purge Unused.
8. Click 'Save As' and save with new name (e.g., 'Family-Cleaned.rfa').

title: Civil 3D: Data Shortcuts are Broken or Missing
problem: Civil 3D objects (like surfaces or alignments) that are data-referenced are missing. 'Prospector' tab may show broken link icon.
solution:
1. In Toolspace panel, Prospector tab, right-click 'Data Shortcuts'.
2. Select 'Set Working Folder...'.
3. Navigate to and select correct project folder containing _Shortcuts folder.
4. Right-click 'Data Shortcuts' again, select 'Validate' to refresh.
5. If links still broken, right-click specific item, choose 'Repair Broken Reference'.

title: Civil 3D: Surface is Not Displaying (No Contours)
problem: A surface has been created or data-referenced, but no contours or triangles are visible in the drawing.
solution:
1. Check Surface Style: Right-click surface in Prospector > Surface Properties.
2. On 'Information' tab, check 'Surface Style'.
3. If set to 'No Display' or 'Border Only', change to style showing contours (e.g., 'Contours 1' and 5'').
4. Check Layer: Style might be correct, but layer may be frozen. Go to Display tab in Surface Style editor, check which layers Major/Minor Contours use.
5. Open Layer Manager, ensure those layers are 'On' and 'Thawed'.
6. Rebuild Surface: Right-click surface in Prospector, select 'Rebuild'.

title: Civil 3D: Drawing Contains Proxy Objects (Missing Object Enabler)
problem: When opening a drawing, user gets 'Proxy Information' pop-up. Drawing may be missing elements or not display correctly.
solution:
1. Identify Source: Ask where file came from.
2. Install Object Enabler: User needs 'AutoCAD Civil 3D Object Enabler' for their version.
3. Go to Autodesk website, search 'Civil 3D [Year] Object Enabler' (e.g., 'Civil 3D 2024 Object Enabler').
4. Download and install this utility. Allows plain AutoCAD user (or older version) to see custom Civil 3D objects.
5. If file from newer version (e.g., 2025 file in 2024), file must be saved down by sender.

title: Civil 3D: Survey Database is Locked or Read-Only
problem: User tries to edit survey data but finds survey database is locked or 'Read-Only', even when no one else is in it. Often caused by 'ghost' lock files.
solution:
1. Have all users close the survey database.
2. Using Windows File Explorer, navigate to folder where survey database is stored.
3. Look for hidden files with same name as database but with .ldb or .mdw extensions.
4. Delete these lock files.
5. Have user re-open project. Database should now be accessible.

title: Microsoft Office: How to Run an Online Repair
problem: A Microsoft Office application (Word, Excel, Outlook) is crashing, freezing, or not behaving correctly. Basic troubleshooting (like reboot) has not fixed the issue.
solution:
1. Close all Microsoft Office applications.
2. Open Windows Start Menu, click Settings gear ⚙.
3. Click 'Apps' (or 'Apps & Features').
4. Scroll down, find 'Microsoft 365' or 'Microsoft Office'.
5. Click on it, then click 'Modify' (or 'Advanced Options' > 'Repair').
6. Select 'Online Repair' (not Quick Repair).
7. Click 'Repair', follow prompts. This may take 10-15 minutes and requires internet.
8. Restart computer when complete.

title: Microsoft Office: How to Recover an Unsaved Document
problem: Word, Excel, or PowerPoint crashed and user did not save their work. Office AutoRecover saves a version in background every few minutes.
solution:
1. Re-open the application (e.g., Word).
2. In most cases, 'Document Recovery' pane will automatically open on left side, showing available recovered files.
3. If it doesn't, go to File > Info > Manage Document (or Manage Workbook/Presentation).
4. Click 'Recover Unsaved Documents' (or Workbooks/Presentations).
5. Browse the AutoRecover folder, select the file, click 'Open'.
6. Immediately click 'Save As' to save it properly.

title: Excel: File is 'Locked for Editing' by Another User
problem: User tries to open an Excel file and gets 'File is locked for editing by another user' message, even though no one else has it open.
solution:
1. Check if anyone ACTUALLY has file open: Ask team members.
2. If no one has it open, the lock file is stuck.
3. Close Excel completely.
4. Navigate to the folder where Excel file is stored.
5. Look for hidden file with same name starting with tilde and dollar sign (~$) (e.g., ~$ProjectData.xlsx).
6. Delete this ~$ lock file.
7. Try opening main Excel file again. Lock should be gone.

title: OneDrive: How to Reset a 'Stuck' Sync
problem: OneDrive sync client is stuck 'Processing Changes', 'Syncing', or not updating with new files from cloud.
solution:
1. Press Windows Key + R to open 'Run' dialog.
2. Copy and paste this command, press Enter: %localappdata%\Microsoft\OneDrive\onedrive.exe /reset
3. OneDrive cloud icon in system tray will disappear and reappear after a minute or two.
4. If it doesn't reappear, open Start Menu, type 'OneDrive', launch application manually.
5. OneDrive will now re-index all files (may take time but resolves most sync issues).

title: Outlook: How to Create a New Mail Profile
problem: Outlook is freezing, not opening, or displaying corruption errors. Creating a new profile often resolves these issues.
solution:
1. Close Outlook completely.
2. Open Control Panel (search 'Control Panel' in Start Menu).
3. Click 'Mail' (or 'Mail (Microsoft Outlook)').
4. Click 'Show Profiles' button.
5. Click 'Add', enter a name for new profile (e.g., 'Outlook-New').
6. Follow setup wizard to add your email account.
7. Once created, set it as default profile.
8. Close Control Panel, launch Outlook. It will use new profile.

title: Outlook: How to Rebuild the Search Index
problem: Outlook search is not finding emails that definitely exist, or search results are incomplete/outdated.
solution:
1. Close Outlook.
2. Open Control Panel > Indexing Options.
3. Click 'Advanced' button.
4. Click 'Rebuild' button under 'Troubleshooting'.
5. Confirm the action. Rebuilding may take several hours.
6. Do NOT close computer or stop process. You can continue using computer but leave indexing running.
7. Once complete, restart Outlook and test search.

title: Outlook: How to Clear the Auto-Complete Cache
problem: When typing an email address, Outlook suggests old or incorrect addresses from auto-complete list.
solution:
Method 1 (Delete Single Entry):
1. Start composing new email.
2. Begin typing the bad address.
3. When it appears in dropdown, hover over it.
4. Press 'Delete' key (or click X).

Method 2 (Clear Entire List):
1. Go to File > Options > Mail.
2. Scroll to 'Send messages' section.
3. Click 'Empty Auto-Complete List' button.
4. Confirm, click OK.

title: Outlook: How to Recall a Sent Message
problem: User sent email to wrong recipient or with incorrect information and wants to recall it. IMPORTANT: Only works if recipient has NOT opened email AND both sender/recipient use Outlook on same Exchange server (internal company email).
solution:
1. Open 'Sent Items' folder.
2. Double-click message to recall (opens in new window).
3. Go to 'Message' tab, click 'Actions' (or 'Move' > 'More Move Actions').
4. Click 'Recall This Message...'.
5. Select option:
   - 'Delete unread copies of this message' (removes it)
   - 'Delete unread copies and replace with new message' (sends correction)
6. Click OK.

NOTE: If recipient already opened email, recall will fail. You'll receive notification either way.

title: Egnyte: How to Restore a Deleted File or Folder
problem: User accidentally deleted a file or folder and needs it restored. Egnyte keeps deleted files in Trash for set period.
solution:
1. Log in to Egnyte web portal (e.g., prime.egnyte.com).
2. In top right, click 'Apps' menu (grid icon), select 'Trash'.
3. Search for file or browse by folder path it was deleted from.
4. Find file/folder to restore.
5. Check box next to its name.
6. Click 'Restore' button.
7. File will be returned to original folder.

NOTE: Files only kept in Trash for limited time (typically 30 days). After that, permanently deleted.

title: Egnyte: File is Locked by Another User
problem: User cannot edit a file stored in Egnyte because it is 'locked' by another user. Often happens if other user's application crashed or they lost internet.
solution:
1. Log in to Egnyte web portal (prime.egnyte.com).
2. Navigate to locked file.
3. Click '...' (More) menu next to file name.
4. Select 'Unlock'. (Option only appears if file is locked).
5. If you don't see 'Unlock' option, you may not have sufficient permissions.
6. If file was locked because user 'Checked it out', Admin may need to 'Discard Check-out' to break lock.

title: FortiClient: Common 'Cannot Connect' Troubleshooting
problem: FortiClient VPN hangs at 98% connection progress, or displays errors like 'Unable to establish VPN connection' or 'Authentication failed'.
solution:
1. Check Internet Connection: Ensure stable internet, try disconnecting/reconnecting WiFi.
2. Verify Credentials: Ensure username/password correct, check MFA token working, try resetting VPN password.
3. Restart FortiClient: Completely close (check system tray), right-click icon > Exit, reopen and try connecting.
4. Flush DNS Cache: Open Command Prompt as Admin, type: ipconfig /flushdns, press Enter.
5. Disable Other VPNs: If other VPN software installed (Cisco, OpenVPN), disable or uninstall.
6. Reinstall FortiClient: Uninstall completely, download latest version, install and reconfigure.
7. Check Firewall/Antivirus: Temporarily disable third-party antivirus/firewall, test VPN. If works, add FortiClient as exception.

Still not working? Submit ticket with exact error message and screenshot.

title: Windows: How to Clear Cached Credentials for VPN
problem: VPN connection fails with authentication error after password change, or connection attempts use old/cached credentials.
solution:
1. Open Control Panel (search in Start Menu).
2. Click 'User Accounts'.
3. Click 'Credential Manager'.
4. Click 'Windows Credentials' tab.
5. Scroll down to find VPN-related credentials (look for VPN server name).
6. Click the arrow to expand, then click 'Remove'.
7. Restart computer.
8. Try connecting to VPN again. It will prompt for fresh credentials.

title: Browser: How to Clear Cache and Cookies (Chrome & Edge)
problem: User experiencing issues with website: pages loading incorrectly, login not working, or old content being displayed. Clearing browser cache and cookies is most common fix.
solution:
For Google Chrome:
1. Open Chrome.
2. Click three-dot menu (⋮) in top right.
3. Select 'Settings'.
4. Scroll down, click 'Privacy and security'.
5. Click 'Clear browsing data'.
6. In dialog box:
   - Time range: Select 'All time' (or specific period)
   - Check: 'Cookies and other site data' AND 'Cached images and files'
7. Click 'Clear data' (or 'Clear now').
8. Close and re-open browser.

For Microsoft Edge: Process is identical (Settings > Privacy > Clear browsing data).

title: Browser: How to Manage Pop-up Blocker Settings
problem: A legitimate website pop-up (like a document viewer or payment window) is being blocked by browser's pop-up blocker.
solution:
For Google Chrome:
1. Click three-dot menu (⋮) > Settings.
2. Click 'Privacy and security'.
3. Click 'Site Settings'.
4. Scroll down, click 'Pop-ups and redirects'.
5. Option 1: Turn off blocker completely (not recommended).
6. Option 2 (Better): Under 'Allowed to send pop-ups', click 'Add'.
7. Enter website URL (e.g., https://example.com), click 'Add'.

For Microsoft Edge: Same process (Settings > Cookies and site permissions > Pop-ups and redirects).

title: Deltek (Vantagepoint / EleVia): Login & Connection Issues
problem: User cannot log into Deltek Vantagepoint, or system hangs at login screen showing 'Connecting to server...' or 'Authentication failed'.
solution:
1. Verify VPN: Ensure connected to company VPN or on office network.
2. Check Credentials: Confirm username/password correct. Try resetting password via company portal.
3. Clear Cache: Close Vantagepoint, navigate to C:\Users\[YourName]\AppData\Local\Deltek, delete temporary cache files.
4. Reinstall Client: If issues persist, uninstall and reinstall Vantagepoint client software.
5. Contact IT: If still failing, submit ticket for database connectivity check.

title: Laptop: How to Properly Undock/Redock from WAVLINK Dock
problem: User experiences issues after undocking/redocking laptop: monitors not detected, USB devices not working, or system unstable.
solution:
PROPER UNDOCKING PROCEDURE:
1. Save all work and close applications.
2. Disconnect USB-C cable from laptop.
3. Wait 5 seconds.
4. Power off dock (unplug power adapter).
5. Wait 10 seconds.

PROPER REDOCKING PROCEDURE:
1. Ensure dock is powered on (AC adapter plugged in).
2. Connect USB-C cable to laptop.
3. Wait for Windows to detect devices (may take 15-30 seconds).
4. If monitors don't appear, press Windows Key + P, select 'Extend'.

NOTE: Do NOT hot-swap cables while dock is powered. Always power cycle dock when troubleshooting.

title: Laptop: Battery Not Charging or Stuck at 60%/80%
problem: Laptop battery not charging, or it charges to certain percentage (often 60% or 80%) and then stops. Many modern laptops have 'Battery Health' feature that limits charging to extend battery lifespan.
solution:
For Dell:
1. Open 'Dell Power Manager' or 'Dell Command | Power Manager'
2. Go to 'Battery Settings'
3. Look for 'Adaptive' or 'ExpressCharge' mode
4. Change to 'Standard' or 'Full Charge' mode

For Lenovo:
1. Open 'Lenovo Vantage' app
2. Go to 'Power' section
3. Find 'Conservation Mode' and turn OFF

For HP:
1. Open 'HP Support Assistant'
2. Go to 'Battery Health Manager'
3. Change from 'Maximum Lifespan' to 'Maximum Runtime'

General Troubleshooting:
- Try different charger/cable
- Remove battery (if removable), hold power button 30 seconds, reconnect
- Update BIOS firmware

title: Laptop: How to Fix Slow Performance (Throttling)
problem: Laptop is running extremely slow, applications are laggy, or system feels sluggish. May be caused by thermal throttling, low disk space, or background processes.
solution:
1. Check Disk Space: Open File Explorer, check C: drive has at least 20GB free. Run Disk Cleanup if needed.
2. Check Task Manager: Press Ctrl+Shift+Esc, look for high CPU/Memory usage. End unnecessary processes.
3. Check Power Plan: Control Panel > Power Options > ensure 'High Performance' or 'Balanced' selected (not 'Power Saver').
4. Check Thermals: Feel bottom of laptop. If extremely hot, shut down, clean air vents with compressed air.
5. Update Drivers: Device Manager > right-click devices > 'Update driver' (especially graphics, chipset).
6. Run Windows Update: Settings > Update & Security > check for updates.
7. Scan for Malware: Run Windows Defender full scan.

title: Windows: How to Free Up Hard Drive Space (Disk Cleanup)
problem: Hard drive is nearly full, system showing 'Low Disk Space' warning, or applications cannot save files.
solution:
1. Open File Explorer, right-click C: drive, select 'Properties'.
2. Click 'Disk Cleanup' button.
3. Check boxes for:
   - Temporary files
   - Recycle Bin
   - Downloads (be careful, review first)
   - Thumbnails
   - Windows Update Cleanup
4. Click 'Clean up system files' button.
5. Check additional boxes:
   - Previous Windows installations
   - Windows upgrade log files
6. Click OK, confirm deletion.
7. Empty Recycle Bin manually.
8. Uninstall unused programs: Settings > Apps > sort by size, remove large unused apps.
9. Move files to OneDrive/Egnyte if possible.

title: Laptop: 'No Bootable Device' Error on Startup
problem: Laptop displays 'No Bootable Device', 'Boot Device Not Found', or 'Operating System Not Found' error on startup. System cannot find hard drive.
solution:
1. Restart laptop, press F2 or F12 repeatedly to enter BIOS/Boot Menu.
2. Check if hard drive is listed in BIOS.
3. If listed: Check boot order, ensure hard drive is first priority.
4. If NOT listed:
   a. Shut down, remove battery (if removable).
   b. Hold power button 30 seconds.
   c. Reconnect battery, power on, check BIOS again.
5. If still not listed, hard drive may be failed or disconnected.
6. IMPORTANT: Submit ticket immediately. This may require hardware repair/replacement.

title: WAVLINK Dock: Monitors Not Detected (DisplayLink Driver)
problem: Laptop connected to WAVLINK USB-C docking station, but external monitors are not being detected.
solution:
1. Check Cable Connection: Ensure USB-C cable firmly connected to BOTH dock and laptop. Try different USB-C port if available.
2. Power Cycle Dock: Disconnect dock's power adapter, wait 10 seconds, reconnect power, then reconnect laptop.
3. Update Drivers:
   - Open Device Manager (right-click Start button)
   - Expand 'Display adapters', right-click each adapter, select 'Update driver'
   - Also check 'Universal Serial Bus controllers', update those
4. Check Monitor Input: Use monitor's physical buttons to ensure correct input selected (HDMI, DisplayPort, etc.).
5. Install DisplayLink Driver: Visit wavlink.com/support, download latest DisplayLink driver for your dock model, install and restart.
6. Test Monitors Individually: Connect one monitor at a time to isolate if it's specific port issue.

title: WAVLINK Dock: USB Ports or Ethernet Not Working
problem: USB devices (mouse, keyboard, external drive) or Ethernet connection not working when plugged into WAVLINK dock.
solution:
1. Check USB-C Cable: Ensure using official/certified USB-C cable that supports data (not just charging).
2. Power Cycle Dock: Unplug power adapter from dock, wait 10 seconds, reconnect.
3. Test Different Ports: Try device in different USB port on dock to isolate faulty port.
4. Check USB Selective Suspend:
   - Control Panel > Power Options > Change plan settings
   - Change advanced power settings
   - Expand 'USB settings' > 'USB selective suspend setting'
   - Set to 'Disabled', apply
5. Update Drivers: Device Manager > Universal Serial Bus controllers > update all USB drivers.
6. For Ethernet: Check if network cable is good (test in different device), check if Ethernet adapter shows in Device Manager.

title: Windows: How to Change Monitor Arrangement
problem: Multiple monitors are detected but arranged in wrong order (e.g., dragging mouse left goes to right monitor). Need to rearrange virtual layout to match physical setup.
solution:
1. Right-click desktop, select 'Display settings'.
2. Scroll to 'Multiple displays' section.
3. You'll see numbered rectangles representing each monitor.
4. Click and drag rectangles to match physical arrangement.
5. Click 'Identify' button to see which number is which monitor.
6. Click 'Apply' to save changes.
7. Test by dragging a window between monitors to verify correct arrangement.

title: Windows: How to Fix Blurry Text on Monitors (ClearType)
problem: Text appears blurry or fuzzy on monitor, especially after connecting new monitor or changing resolution.
solution:
1. Right-click desktop, select 'Display settings'.
2. Ensure resolution is set to 'Recommended' (native resolution of monitor).
3. In search bar, type 'ClearType', select 'Adjust ClearType text'.
4. Check 'Turn on ClearType', click Next.
5. Follow wizard, selecting text samples that look best to you.
6. Complete wizard, click Finish.
7. If still blurry, check monitor's physical buttons for 'Auto-Adjust' or 'Sharpness' settings.

title: Monitor: No Signal or 'Input Not Supported' Error
problem: Monitor displays 'No Signal', 'Input Not Supported', or goes black/blank screen.
solution:
1. Check Cable: Ensure video cable (HDMI, DisplayPort, VGA) firmly connected to BOTH monitor and computer.
2. Check Input Source: Use monitor's physical buttons to cycle through input sources (HDMI 1, HDMI 2, DisplayPort, etc.).
3. Check Resolution: If 'Input Not Supported', resolution may be too high for monitor. Boot in Safe Mode (restart, press F8), lower resolution.
4. Test Cable: Try different video cable to rule out faulty cable.
5. Test Monitor: Connect monitor to different computer to verify monitor is functional.
6. Update Graphics Driver: Device Manager > Display adapters > Update driver.

title: Mobile Device: How to Set Up Company Email (Outlook App)
problem: User needs to access company email (Microsoft 365/Exchange) on iPhone or Android device.
solution:
RECOMMENDED METHOD: Use Outlook App (Best Security & Features)

1. Download 'Microsoft Outlook' from App Store (iOS) or Google Play (Android)
2. Open app, tap 'Get Started' or 'Add Account'
3. Enter company email address (e.g., john.doe@primeeng.com)
4. Tap 'Continue'
5. Enter password when prompted
6. If asked for Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), approve request on phone or enter code
7. Complete setup wizard
8. Done! Email, calendar, contacts will sync

ALTERNATIVE: Native iPhone Mail App
1. Settings > Mail > Accounts > Add Account
2. Select 'Microsoft Exchange'
3. Enter email and password
4. Follow authentication prompts
5. Toggle ON: Mail, Contacts, Calendars as needed

NOTE: Outlook app provides better security, notifications, and Teams integration.

title: Mobile Device: How to Fix Outlook App Sync Issues
problem: Outlook app on mobile device not syncing emails, or showing old/outdated messages.
solution:
1. Check Internet Connection: Ensure device has WiFi or cellular data.
2. Force Close App: Swipe up (iOS) or recent apps button (Android), swipe Outlook away.
3. Reopen Outlook: Wait 10 seconds, reopen app.
4. Check Sync Settings:
   - Open Outlook app
   - Tap profile icon (top left)
   - Tap gear icon (Settings)
   - Tap your email account
   - Ensure 'Sync Mail' is ON
5. Remove and Re-add Account:
   - Settings > tap account > 'Delete Account'
   - Re-add account following setup steps
6. Update App: Check App Store/Google Play for Outlook updates.
7. Restart Device: Power off completely, wait 30 seconds, power on.

title: Conference Room: How to Connect a Laptop to the TV
problem: User wants to display laptop screen on conference room TV for presentation.
solution:
1. Locate HDMI Cable: Usually on conference table or near TV.
2. Connect to Laptop: Plug HDMI cable into laptop's HDMI port (may need USB-C to HDMI adapter for newer laptops).
3. Turn On TV: Use remote or power button on TV.
4. Select HDMI Input: Use TV remote, press 'Input' or 'Source' button, select correct HDMI port (HDMI 1, HDMI 2, etc.).
5. Extend Display (Windows): Press Windows Key + P, select:
   - 'Duplicate' (same on both screens)
   - 'Extend' (separate workspace)
   - 'Second screen only' (laptop screen off)
6. Extend Display (Mac): System Preferences > Displays > Arrangement tab.
7. Adjust Resolution: If image looks stretched/cut off, right-click desktop > Display settings > adjust resolution.

title: Conference Room: No Audio in Teams/Zoom Call
problem: During Microsoft Teams or Zoom call in conference room, participants cannot hear audio from laptop/PC, or room microphone not picking up sound.
solution:
QUICK CHECKS:
1. Volume Levels: Check laptop/PC volume turned up (not muted), check conference room AV system volume (physical knob or touch panel).
2. Mute Status: Click microphone icon in Teams/Zoom to ensure not muted. Check physical mute button on conference room microphone/speaker.
3. Select Correct Audio Device:
   - In Teams/Zoom, click profile picture (top right)
   - Go to 'Settings' > 'Devices' (or 'Audio')
   - Under 'Audio devices':
     * Speaker: Select conference room speaker (e.g., 'Polycom Trio', 'Logitech Rally')
     * Microphone: Select conference room microphone
   - Click 'Make a test call' to verify
4. Cable Connections: Ensure HDMI or USB cable firmly connected to laptop. For USB conference systems, try different USB port.
5. Restart Equipment: End call, unplug conference room device for 10 seconds, reconnect, rejoin call.

STILL HAVING ISSUES? Try different laptop to rule out PC issues. Submit ticket for IT to inspect conference room setup.

title: 3D Mouse: 3Dconnexion SpaceMouse Not Working in 3ds Max
problem: 3Dconnexion SpaceMouse (3D puck) works on desktop but does not function (or stops working) inside 3ds Max.
solution:
1. Check 3ds Max Driver: In 3ds Max, go to Customize > Preferences > 3Dconnexion tab.
2. Verify Device Listed: Should show your SpaceMouse model. If not, driver not installed.
3. Re-run Driver Installer:
   - Download latest '3Dconnexion Software' from 3dconnexion.com
   - During installation, ensure '3ds Max' is checked in application list
   - Complete installation, restart computer
4. Check Device Manager: Windows Device Manager > Human Interface Devices > look for '3Dconnexion' device. If yellow triangle, update driver.
5. Reinstall 3ds Max Add-in: Some versions require separate add-in installation.
6. Test in Different Application: Try SpaceMouse in Windows desktop or web browser to verify hardware functional.
